required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Walk With Me: a Mobile Application to Improve Walking in Persons With MS
clinical_study.official_title: Walk With Me: a Mobile Application to Improve Walking in Persons With MS

brief_summary.textblock: During 10 weeks the subjects will use a mobile application (Walk with Me). The aim of this study is to investigate the usability of the mobile application, as well as investigating if the mobile application effects walking.

primary_outcome.measure: VAS score pre 6-minute walk test (6 MWT) indoor
primary_outcome.description: he instructor will ask the participant to rate their fatigue from 0-10 (0= no fatigue, 10= most fatigued ever)

primary_outcome.measure: VAS score pre 6-minute walk test (6 MWT) outdoor
primary_outcome.description: he instructor will ask the participant to rate their fatigue from 0-10 (0= no fatigue, 10= most fatigued ever)

primary_outcome.measure: VAS score pre 6-minute walk test (6 MWT) indoor
primary_outcome.description: he instructor will ask the participant to rate their fatigue from 0-10 (0= no fatigue, 10= most fatigued ever)

primary_outcome.measure: VAS score pre 6-minute walk test (6 MWT) outdoor
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be instructed to perform the 6MWT. After this test the instructor will ask the participant to rate their fatigue from 0-10 (0= no fatigue, 10= most fatigued ever).

primary_outcome.measure: VAS score pre 6-minute walk test (6 MWT) indoor
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be instructed to perform the 6MWT. After this test the instructor will ask the participant to rate their fatigue from 0-10 (0= no fatigue, 10= most fatigued ever).

primary_outcome.measure: VAS score pre 6-minute walk test (6 MWT) outdoor
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be instructed to perform the 6MWT. After this test the instructor will ask the participant to rate their fatigue from 0-10 (0= no fatigue, 10= most fatigued ever).

primary_outcome.measure: Distance walked index during the 6MWT indoor
primary_outcome.description: During this test participants are instructed to walk as far as possible on a 30-meter course for 6 minutes. The distance walked is recorded every minute. The distance of the last minute is compared to the distance walked in the first minute to find the index.

primary_outcome.measure: Distance walked index during the 6MWT outdoor
primary_outcome.description: During this test participants are instructed to walk as far as possible on a 30-meter course for 6 minutes. The distance walked is recorded every minute. The distance of the last minute is compared to the distance walked in the first minute to find the index.

primary_outcome.measure: Distance walked index during the 6MWT indoor
primary_outcome.description: During this test participants are instructed to walk as far as possible on a 30-meter course for 6 minutes. The distance walked is recorded every minute. The distance of the last minute is compared to the distance walked in the first minute to find the index.

primary_outcome.measure: Distance walked index during the 6MWT outdoor
primary_outcome.description: During this test participants are instructed to walk as far as possible on a 30-meter course for 6 minutes. The distance walked is recorded every minute. The distance of the last minute is compared to the distance walked in the first minute to find the index.
This is a short questionnaire to map out walking difficulties in daily living.
This is a short questionnaire to map out walking difficulties in daily living.

primary_outcome.measure: the Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test (PASAT) (Cognitive Fatigability)
primary_outcome.description: This is a cognitive test where the participant will try to retain certain numbers they hear and do math. Correct answer last 1/3 vs first 1/3

primary_outcome.measure: the Paced Auditory Serial Addition Test (PASAT) (Cognitive Fatigability)
primary_outcome.description: This is a cognitive test where the participant will try to retain certain numbers they hear and do math. Correct answer last 1/3 vs first 1/3

primary_outcome.measure: the Symbol Digit Modality Test (SDMT) (Cognitive fatigability)
primary_outcome.description: his is a cognitive performance test, substantiated with focus, speed, and visual scanning. Correct answers last 30 seconds vs first 30 seconds

primary_outcome.measure: the Symbol Digit Modality Test (SDMT) (Cognitive fatigability)
primary_outcome.description: his is a cognitive performance test, substantiated with focus, speed, and visual scanning. Correct answers last 30 seconds vs first 30 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: 5 times sit to stand (5xSTS) (Motor Function test)
secondary_outcome.description: This is a motor test to assess the functional lower limb muscle strength. The participant is asked to stand from a seated position and sit down again as fast as possible for five times in a row.

secondary_outcome.measure: 5 times sit to stand (5xSTS) (Motor Function test)
secondary_outcome.description: This is a motor test to assess the functional lower limb muscle strength. The participant is asked to stand from a seated position and sit down again as fast as possible for five times in a row.
This is a motor test at which the participant is instructed to walk 25 ft (=7,62 meter) as fast and safely as possible. This is a quantitative performance test to assess mobility and leg function.
This is a motor test at which the participant is instructed to walk 25 ft (=7,62 meter) as fast and safely as possible. This is a quantitative performance test to assess mobility and leg function.
This is a motor test to assess the participant's manual skills. This test records the time the participant needs to place 9 pins in the pegboard and remove them again.
This is a motor test to assess the participant's manual skills. This test records the time the participant needs to place 9 pins in the pegboard and remove them again.
This is a short questionnaire to evaluate to impact of general fatigue. This questionnaire measures the effects of fatigue on three levels: physical, cognitive and psychosocial.
This is a short questionnaire to evaluate to impact of general fatigue. This questionnaire measures the effects of fatigue on three levels: physical, cognitive and psychosocial.
This is a short questionnaire to measure the severity of general fatigue.
This is a short questionnaire to measure the severity of general fatigue.
This is a short self-report questionnaire used to assess the day-to-day life in the past two weeks. This questionnaire has a physical and psychological scale.
This is a short self-report questionnaire used to assess the day-to-day life in the past two weeks. This questionnaire has a physical and psychological scale.
This is a short questionnaire to measure health status.
This is a short questionnaire to measure health status.
This is a questionnaire to measure health-related physical activity
This is a questionnaire to measure health-related physical activity

intervention.description: For 10 weeks the subjects will use a mobile application (Walk with Me). The aim of this study is to investigate the usability of the mobile application, as well as investigating if the mobile application effects walking

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed diagnosis according to the McDonald Criteria
- Able to walk independently or with unilateral support for 10 minutes
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exacerbation or relapse within last 3 months before study
- Other medical condition interfering with walking ability (e.g. cardiac or respiratory diseases, arthritis and fibromyalgia, stroke, Parkinson).
